text: The Champion Swordsmen are handpicked from regiments across the Imperial provinces. Their blades carve through the Empire’s foes, forging a path to victory.

As the Emperor’s personal guard, the Vanguard operates independently of all authority but his. This elite group of eight combines unparalleled swordsmanship with mastery of literature, politics, and the arts to provide the Emperor with unrivaled service.
The Holy Knights, sworn to the Church of Sigmar, forsake their worldly ties to fight for the Empire’s faith and protect its sanctity.
The Dusk Knights pledge their lives to the Colleges of Magic, offering their swords in defense of the academies in exchange for glimpses into the mysteries of the Eight Winds.

The Imperial Dragon, the only dragon within the Empire, is an ancient being of unimaginable age. Once a ruler of the world, it now slumbers deep within Altdorf’s zoo. Should it awaken, all deemed enemies will be reduced to ashes beneath its inferno.
The Grim Angels are experts in combating heresy, drawn from witch-hunting guilds across the provinces. Each member’s exploits rival the most captivating tales of minstrels.

The Legion of the Faithful embodies his divine will in the mortal realm. Typically stationed within Altdorf’s palace as an inner guard, they march forth only when Sigmar calls upon them for his crusades.

The Silent Heavens consist of devout and gifted anti-magic warriors. By adhering to the Seven Sacred Vows, including the Oath of Silence, they become Sigmar’s mortal angels, silent enemies of evil sorcery and ruthless executioners.
The Ebon Maidens, armed enforcers of the Sigmarite Church, possess unparalleled combat prowess and fervent prayers. They wield their faith to shield the Empire’s people and smite its foes.

Forged in Nuln, the Steam Reliquaries are marvels of Imperial engineering. Legends claim each machine houses the soul of a great Imperial hero, its mechanical form driven by steam and gears to obliterate the unfaithful.
The Golden Sons are formed by Altdorf’s noble youth, eager to become true heroes of the Empire. These romantic warriors possess a dazzling combination of skill and honor.
The Black Wardens are Myrmidia's most loyal followers. Clad in black armor, they serve as guardians of her temples and spread her faith across the Old World.

The Inner Circle Knights are the elite of every knightly order. Chosen as leaders, Grandmasters embody knightly virtues and guide their brethren as some of the most formidable warriors in the Old World.
Encased in heavy armor, these foot knights form the backbone of the Empire's military, holding the line with unmatched resolve.
Laurel Knights, drawn from the Reiksguard's Inner Circle, charge into battle atop loyal demi-gryphs, their pride and ferocity unmatched.
Before forming the Blood Oath Brotherhood, its members endured countless battles against Khorne. Haunted by guilt and rage, they swore an unbreakable bond to fight Chaos for eternity.
Imperial Huntsmen are the most agile marksmen in the Empire. They harass enemy lines or use their keen eyes to scout and secure the battlefield.
Clad in fine uniforms, these handgunners hail from across the Empire. Their disciplined volleys annihilate enemies at range, while their swordsmanship ensures victory in close combat.
The Night  Ravens prowl the darkness, hunting undead monstrosities and illuminating the Empire's path with their unyielding fire.
The Tirith Shieldbearers, hailing from the City-States, are deadly mercenaries. Their heavy crossbows and towering shields make them a formidable presence in the Imperial ranks.
Ulric's Wolves channel the Winter God's wrath into the mortal realm, their fiery zeal burning away Chaos's chill.
The “Claw of Ulric”, named for a legendary wolf, represents the White Wolf God's fury. Revered as the War God's mortal incarnation, it is said to protect the faithful in dire times.
The War Priests are elite warriors of Sigmar’s Church, candidates for War Priesthood who fearlessly defend the faith on the battlefield.
